definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]

sentences.english: Don't worry, he's still full of one-liners and quips.
sentences.chinese: 別擔心，他仍然滿嘴俏皮話一針見血。

sentences.english: Your analysis really hit the nail on the head.
sentences.chinese: 你的分析確實一針見血。

sentences.english: Sakamoto Ryoma Museum Curator Shiro Mori pointed out sharply that health.
sentences.chinese: 坂本龍馬紀念館館長森健志郎一針見血地指出。

sentences.english: With heart-piercing accuracy, Jesus states that hard-heartedness causes marriage breakdown.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌一針見血地指出，是人的心硬導致了婚姻破裂。

sentences.english: She always analyzes problems in a simple and direct way.
sentences.chinese: 分析問題都很簡截，卻往往一針見血。

sentences.english: To find out the truth you have to ask the right questions.
sentences.chinese: 問題要問得一針見血，方能看清真相。

sentences.english: Zhang Bin, sometimes you could see straight, can also pierce to the heart of the matter.
sentences.chinese: 張斌，有時你看問題很準，也能一針見血。

sentences.english: His remarks always hit the nail on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他的評論總是一針見血。

sentences.english: The logic in the page is fairly simple, but it illustrates the point.
sentences.chinese: 頁面中的邏輯相當簡單，但一針見血。

definition: lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
specious arguments/sophistry
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
hard to understand/incomprehensible
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
sore spot/place that hurts
to have nothing to say (idiom)
